Dear Kari Ann Klinski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the manager at 616-552-3662 or triestrac@michigan.gov.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to

Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.

Type
Allegation Youth A reported he was raped by Youth B in Youth B's room.
Investigation This complaint was received on 5/24/23. The complaint noted the
following:
The Lincoln Center, Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services, is where
Youth A (14) and Youth B (14) are currently lodged. Yesterday,
05/22/2023, Youth A entered the bedroom of a peer, Youth B.
The two walked in together and walked out together with less than
one minute in Youth B's bedroom. Youth B tried to kiss Youth A,
pull Youth A's pants down. It was also alleged that Youth B raped
Youth A. There is camera footage of the two boys entering Youth
B’s room and walking out less than one minute later. Youth
Specialist 1 was on the pod at the time they entered and just
before they walked out of the room a different staff entered the
pod. The door of the bedroom was open the entire time the two
boys were in the room. There has not been a physical
examination or a SANE. Youth A is not reporting any pain and he
has not requested any medical care. Both minors have been
adjudicated and have CSC convictions against them, which is the
reason for their placement at Lincoln Center.
The complainant was Lincoln Center's Director. She reported that
Youth A and B are on Pod G and Youth A reported he was raped
by Youth B. Youth Specialist 1 was working on the Pod when the
alleged incident happened. She reported she watched the video
of the incident, and the youth are in the bedroom for under 1
minute. The Director reported Youth A's therapist talked with him
after he made the allegations, and it was discovered Youth A did
not know what rape meant and said he thought it meant when
someone touches you sexually.
I interviewed Youth A face to face on 5/24/23 at the facility. Youth
A reported he was forced to enter Youth B's pod as Youth B
threatened to "shank him" if he didn't do it. Youth A reported that
Youth Specialist 1 was asleep on the pod and Youth B entered his
own room and Youth A followed. Youth A reported Youth B
2

slammed him against the wall, kissed him on the neck and mouth,
pulled his shirt up around his neck, and pulled down his pants and
sucked his penis "a couple seconds". Youth A reported another
staff opened the door to the pod and announced a peer that was
returning to the pod causing Youth A and Youth B to run out of
Youth B's room. Youth A reported the staff member did not enter
the pod and only let the youth in. Youth A reported he is
uncomfortable around Youth B and wants moved from the Pod.
Youth A reported their rooms have been separated on the Pod
with one of them being in room 1 and the other in room 9. Youth A
reported being raped to Supervisor J about hour after the event.
Youth A was asked if he was raped, and he reported that he
thought any sexual touching was called rape and denied that
penetration occurred. Youth A confirmed that he was sexually
touched against his will. Youth A is placed at Lincoln Center on
the sexual offender Pod and has criminal sexual conduct charges.
I interviewed Youth B face to face at the facility on 5/24/23. Youth
B denied he and Youth A were in his room together. Youth B
reported Youth A is lying about being in his room as he wants off
the Pod and doesn't like the youth on the Pod. Youth B denied
having a shank or weapon of any kind and denied threatening to
shank Youth A. Youth B denied sexually touching or raping Youth
A. Youth B reported he and Youth A were “in a relationship” from
January until March and Youth A is upset that Youth B broke up
with him. Youth B reported Youth A follows him around the Pod.
When Youth B was told the video was reviewed and he is seen
going into his room and Youth A goes into his room behind him he
continued to deny being in his room with Youth A and said, "we
were not in my room ".
VIDEO:

8:57:21 Youth A and B are on the Pod by the showers talking.

I interviewed Youth Specialist 1 via the phone on 5/30/23. Youth
Specialist 1 reported both Youth A and Youth B were on the Pod
because of ratios at school that day. If a teacher calls off and they
don’t have enough teachers, they rotate the youth in and out of
the classrooms. The school is not staffed by Lincoln Center they
have a charter school who comes in and does it, so they have no
control over youth needing to be on the pod. Youth Specialist 1
reported Youth A was goofing around and running in and out of
other residents' rooms and he instructed him to stop. Youth
Specialist 1 reported he never saw Youth A and Youth B enter
Youth B's room and he does not believe it happened. Youth
Specialist 1 denied he was asleep and reported he was having
eye pain that day and that is why his head was cocked to the side
and he appeared to be sleeping. He reported he had put eye
drops in for the pain and that is why he was sitting the way he
was.
I interviewed the facility director face to face at the facility on
5/24/23. She reported that Youth Specialist 1 has been employed
with them for the past 4-5 months and has one write up and a
suspension for not keeping line of sight on a resident. There are a
total of 10 residents on Pod G, but all were not present on the Pod
when the incident occurred. The majority of the youth were at
school and three residents were on the Pod. There is a 2:10 ratio
on Pod G and Youth Specialist 1 was on the pod and in ratio. The
4

Director reported the staff and youth seen on video entering the
Pod reported they did not see anything as the staff did not enter
the Pod and only announced the resident and then closed the Pod
door.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
Emergency Medical Note dated 5/24/23 from Emergency Room.
Dr. Amy Delaroche saw Youth A for reported sexual assault.
Youth A reported nonconsensual touching occurred and denied
any injuries and no penetration sex performed. Youth A’s physical
exam was benign.
Lincoln Center Unusual Incident Report dated 5/22/23 @ 8:57am.
Authored by Facility Manager. Report indicates Youth A reported
he was sexually assaulted by Youth B.
Safety Plan for Youth A and Youth B. Residents will be in
separate rooms on opposite sides of the Pod. Residents cannot
interact together and will sit apart from one another in school and
in the dining area. Staff and teachers will ensure Youth A and
Youth B are not together. If the Pod needs to be split Youth A and
Youth B will be on separate Pods.
Both youth are placed on the sex offender Pod. Their files were
reviewed and indicate they both have a history of sexual offenses.
Analysis Based upon interviews and video there is evidence that supports
Youth Specialist 1 did not have the ability to perform the duties of
his position. Video confirms Youth A and Youth B entered Youth
B's room while Youth Specialist 1 was on the Pod monitoring
them. Youth A reported he was sexually abused by Youth B
during that time and that the Youth Specialist was asleep. The
Youth Specialist does not react or get out of his chair when the
boys enter Youth B's room. Youth Specialist 1 denies seeing the
youth enter the bedroom and indicated he was having eye pain
that day. Line of sight was not maintained, and the boys were able
to enter Youth B’s room for 43 seconds.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance (TA) was provided during special
investigation 20230000450 regarding the resident’s doors needing
to be locked when youth are not in their rooms. Unlocked room
doors interfere with staff’s ability to maintain line of sight of the
youth resulting in supervision/safety issues. If that TA had been
implemented, this situation would have been avoided.
